etymologies: late 18th century (as a noun): from German Sinter; compare with cinder

definitions: a hard siliceous or calcareous deposit precipitated from mineral springs.
shortDefinitions: hard siliceous or calcareous deposit precipitated from mineral springs

definitions: solid material which has been sintered, especially a mixture of iron ore and other materials prepared for smelting

examples.text: typical blast-furnace burdens are 80% sinter, 20% ore

shortDefinitions: solid material which has been sintered

definitions: make (a powdered material) coalesce into a solid or porous mass by heating it (and usually also compressing it) without liquefaction

examples.text: when the moisture is removed from the slurry the powder compact is sintered
metal powders sinter together under pressure

shortDefinitions: make powdered material coalesce into solid or porous mass by heating it and usually also compressing it without liquefaction
